data.title: Recording Industry Association of America
data.meta_description: The Recording Industry Association of America, often abbreviated as RIAA, is an organization that "supports and promotes the creative and financial vitality of the major music companies."[1] It awards certifications to albums and singles that have reached a certain number of sales. Albums...
data.text:
The Recording Industry Association of America, often abbreviated as RIAA, is an organization that "supports and promotes the creative and financial vitality of the major music companies."[1] It awards certifications to albums and singles that have reached a certain number of sales. Albums/singles with 500,000 units are Gold certified, ones with 1,000,000 units are Platinum certified, ones with 2,000,000 units are Multi-Platinum certified, and ones with 10,000,000 units are Diamond certified.

Melanie Martinez currently has 17 Gold certified singles, 8 Platinum certified singles, 3 Multi-Platinum certified singles along with 1 Multi-Platinum certified album which is Cry Baby and one Gold certified album, K-12. All of Melanie's certifications can be seen here.

Title Gold certification date Platinum certification date 2x Platinum certification date Cry Baby June 9, 2016 February 24, 2017 June 4, 2021 K-12 September 13, 2021 N/A N/A

Gallery[]

Trivia[]

In celebration of Cry Baby's 5th anniversary, a platinum plaque was given to a fan through a contest.

Melanie was shooting her Extra Credit series on the day she got the platinum plaque for Cry Baby as an album.

When Melanie received the platinum plaque for Cry Baby as an album, Atlantic held a private party at their headquarters, with people dressed as the Bunny Doctor and with a cake that had the album cover printed on it.

Michael Keenan also has one plaque at his house, which can be seen in their interview with TikTok.

Melanie is the first and currently only female artist to have all tracks on her album, standard and deluxe, with certifications.
